I am having same issue on Gentoo system with CUDA 9 and CudNN 7 which discussed elsewhere might work, I am giving it try now.

@goldsborough what is the value of the variable? I suggest it is simply /usr/lib64 (I am on gentoo system):

andromeda /var/lib/layman/archenroot/sci-libs/tensorflow # equery f nvidia-cuda-cudnn
 * Searching for nvidia-cuda-cudnn ...
 * Contents of dev-libs/nvidia-cuda-cudnn-7.0:
/usr
/usr/include
/usr/include/cudnn.h
/usr/lib64
/usr/lib64/libcudnn.so -> libcudnn.so.7
/usr/lib64/libcudnn.so.7 -> libcudnn.so.7.0.4
/usr/lib64/libcudnn.so.7.0.4
/usr/lib64/libcudnn_static.a

While I exported both variables it is failing now at:

Invalid path to cuDNN 6 toolkit. None of the following files can be found:
/usr/lib64/lib64/libcudnn.so.6
/usr/lib64/libcudnn.so.6
/usr/lib64/libcudnn.so.6
Please specify the cuDNN version you want to use. [Leave empty to default to cuDNN 6.0]:

body:
I am having same issue on Gentoo system with CUDA 9 and CudNN 7 which discussed elsewhere might work, I am giving it try now.

@goldsborough what is the value of the variable? I suggest it is simply /usr/lib64 (I am on gentoo system):
```
andromeda /var/lib/layman/archenroot/sci-libs/tensorflow # equery f nvidia-cuda-cudnn
 * Searching for nvidia-cuda-cudnn ...
 * Contents of dev-libs/nvidia-cuda-cudnn-7.0:
/usr
/usr/include
/usr/include/cudnn.h
/usr/lib64
/usr/lib64/libcudnn.so -> libcudnn.so.7
/usr/lib64/libcudnn.so.7 -> libcudnn.so.7.0.4
/usr/lib64/libcudnn.so.7.0.4
/usr/lib64/libcudnn_static.a

```

While I exported both variables it is failing now at:
```
Invalid path to cuDNN 6 toolkit. None of the following files can be found:
/usr/lib64/lib64/libcudnn.so.6
/usr/lib64/libcudnn.so.6
/usr/lib64/libcudnn.so.6
Please specify the cuDNN version you want to use. [Leave empty to default to cuDNN 6.0]: 
```
